In this interactive gallery program, Chicago poets Kathleen Rooney and Eric Plattner read and wrote poems in response to Go. Visitors joined in the program by requesting a poem written about artworks on view in the exhibition.

Since the summer of 2011, when they made their debut at Wicker Park Fest, the poets of Poems While You Wait have been subverting the cliché of the solitary writer toiling in obscurity by bringing themselves—and their typewriters—to public places throughout the city of Chicago and composing commissioned poetry on demand for strangers. The process is simple: the customer commissions a poem by requesting a subject of their choosing, and then waiting ten–fifteen minutes while one of the poets creates a custom-made, original poem to keep or to give away as a gift. fig. 1
